runs.comm: starts with a wide down the leg side, a bit of swing towards Dhoni's right, and they pick up an extra run off the fumble
full, straighter, pushed to mid-off
a bit of swing in from outside off, driven towards Rahane at short cover
length ball outside off, left alone
outswinger outside off, left alone again
on a nice length in the corridor, angled in and shaped away. Berenger shaped to play and then decided to leave
full and wide and he chases after it and slices it in the air and into the gap through cover point

starts with the bouncer, at the batsman's throat. Goes for the hook and top-edges it high in the air. Rohit dives to his left after running from short midwicket, can't quite get to the ball, which falls a couple of yards away
length ball outside off. Berenger rocked back and across to pull, it shaped away a touch and he ended up flat-batting it back to the bowler
lovely. Leaves Berenger from a good length outside off, close enough to force him to play, and it beats him and carries through to Dhoni
gone! Another bouncer, too quick for Berenger to hook. Top edge loops behind him and Dhoni takes a simple catch after taking a couple of steps to his left
and Umesh beats him first ball. Nice length, and Chandran is frozen to his crease, and plays and misses at a nice outswinger outside off
aaaand again. This one was angled in a bit further, and shaped away even more to open up the batsman as it swerved past his outside edge. He was looking to play it with the angle into the on side
back of a length, swinging into middle and leg, tucked away towards backward square leg

big appeal for lbw, not given. Angled it in from wide of the crease, and it straightened just a touch as the batsman looked to work it leg side. Went past his outside edge and hit the back pad. That looked quite close, in line with off stump. Not reviewed. Height, maybe.
this one stays with the angle across the left-hander, and he leaves it alone
short ball, Amjad is a little late on the pull, top edges it loopily a fair distance to the right of Dhoni
slides into the pads, and he can't connect with the flick, runs off the side of the pad backward of square
back of a length, a touch too straight, worked off the hips towards long leg
bounce and swing into Amjad, cramps him as he goes back and across to defend, hits him on the thigh pad
length ball slanting away outside off, a bit of shape in but not enough to make Amjad play
this one's even wider and it's an easier leave
a little fuller, swinging in. Goes for the flick and can't connect. Off the pads towards short midwicket
looks to pull one that isn't particularly short, and ends up scooping it up towards Raina at leg slip. Sticks his right hand in the air, can't hold on. No bat on it, actually. Off the thigh pad
back of a length in the corridor, dabbed to backward point
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Chandran is back and across to defend
wider outside off this time, left alone
stays back to a length ball on off stump, defends with soft hands towards point
back of a length outside off, gets on his toes to defend towards point
and here's the one that goes the other way. Snakes in towards off stump, and Chandran, hopping back and across, jabs his bat down a little late and the inside-edge runs away towards fine leg

bouncer, Amjad goes for the hook, and it flies through to Dhoni, who appeals loudly for caught behind. Bowden gives it out, and Amjad walks away without complaint or review, so there must have been a thin edge on it. Glove, replays suggest.
back of a length, again that curl away, and Chandran shuffles across, pokes, and misses
shorter, not so much shape this time, and he gets nicely behind it to defend
another bouncer, Chandran ducks low under it
short outside off with some movement away, Chandran jumps across and drops his bat away from the line to leave it alone
beaten again. This one's fuller, and angles in to force Chandran to play at it, before moving away off the pitch to beat his edge
even fuller now, moves away, and Chandran's feet are stuck in the crease. Pokes at it and edges it thickly towards point
back of a length, angling across Khurram, who takes a big step back and across and calmly shoulders arms
a touch fuller and closer to off stump. Back and across again to prod it away towards third man
full on off stump, clipped towards mid-on
full again, outside off, no real swing this time and he leans forward to push it away through the covers. Didn't look to hit it hard, just met it with the full face
back of a length outside off, defended towards mid-off off the back foot
inswinger now, very full, and Chandran blocks it down to mid-off
fullish, slanting away wide outside off, Khurram leaves it alone
a bit fuller, a little closer to the batsman, close enough for the umpire to not signal wide. Left alone again
length ball swerving in towards middle stump. Khurram hops in the air and defends into the on side
back of a length in the corridor, jumps across and steers it away to third man
length ball on off and middle, goes back and across to play that towards short midwicket
full now, outside off, invites the drive. Goes at it with an angled bat and he's beaten by bounce rather than movement
a little shorter and wider, left alone
short and wide, gets on his toes and slashes it away in the air, into the vacant space to the left of third man
fuller now but still wide outside off, left alone
length ball, a lot of swing into Khurram, who's hit on the pads as he jumps back and across to defend
again some swing into Khurram, this time he manages to work it away off his hips wide of mid-on
bouncer, Chandran bends at the waist to get under it
full, slanting down leg, Chandran can't make contact as he looks to whip it away
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, back and across and defends back to the bowler
big appeal for lbw as this straightens late to pin Khurram to the crease and hit his pad as he tries to defend. Pitched outside leg, was probably missing leg too
a touch shorter, tucked away towards long leg

aaah, edged through the slips. That was on a nice length outside off, drawing the poke away from the body with no footwork. Away swing produces the edge, and it flies away between second and third slip
bouncer, ducks low under it. Square leg umpire signals wide for height
in the blockhole, swings in late, and Khurram has to bring his bat down in a hurry to keep that out and whip it towards midwicket
very full again, and he has his head in his hands as Khurram brings his bat down quickly and gets an inside edge into his pads. No edge, on second look. Just the pad, but angling down leg
back of a length outside off, Khurram slashes and misses
tossed up outside off, presses forward to defend towards point
given! Ashwin dangles this slow outside off, entices Krishnan forward to defend. It dips and bounces and that hits his glove, on to thigh pad, and a simple catch to leg slip
fuller, straighter and quicker. Patil stretches forward to defend
a bit more loop on this, turns in from outside off. Patil comes forward and defends with the turn, into the on side
a bit of loop again but Patil reads the length well and goes on the back foot, works it with the turn through square leg
full and flat, angling in towards off stump, Khurram blocks it back to the bowler
starts with a bouncer outside off. Batsman sways, square leg umpire calls wide
short and wide, inviting punishment. Patil slaps it away to the point boundary
shortish outside off, hops across to punch towards backward point
beauty. A bit of inswing, and it's fuller. Patil is on the crease, jabs down and gets an inside edge onto his pads
fullish again, a bit of swing in towards off stump. Gets a front-foot stride out this time to defend
again a fullish length, attacking off stump. Patil shuffles across to defend towards mid-on
bangs it in this time and Patil hops to get on top of the bounce and play that down smartly towards point
tossed up, a bit of width outside off. Khurram goes on the back foot and chops it to backward point
even slower, a bit fuller and closer to off stump, and he comes forward to dab it away towards third man
flatter now, angling in towards off stump. Patil presses forward to block
this one's angled into the pads and he's on the front foot to tuck it away through square leg
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended from halfway forward into the off side
a bit quicker and it goes with the angle to cramp Khurram, who was on the back foot to try and force it through the off side. Pokes it away to short cover
was that a slower ball? It was fairly full, and Patil's feet were frozen. Overbalanced a touch as he looked to defend, and it came in off the pitch to hit him on the pad
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball on a fourth-stump line, defended off the front foot into the covers
fullish, a bit wider outside off, left alone
full, a bit of late shape in towards off stump. Swapnil stays vigilant, blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched towards point
that looked like a slow, seam-up ball that swung in towards Khurram from outside off. The old-fashioned arm ball, driven confidently through cover.
slides into the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
nice loop close to off stump and he gets on the front foot to dab it away towards backward point

arm-ball does the trick! Seam pointing towards slip, and it's to that fielder that Patil edges it as he presses forward to defend. Swings away late, and Dhawan takes an excellent catch, diving to his right
tossed up outside off, driven smoothly to short cover
edged, and that runs away towards third man. Full, slanting away from Khurram, who gets forward and pushes at it with an angled bat
short outside off, Shaiman leaves it alone, swaying out of the way
full on off stump, clipped wristily to mid-on
short ball, pulled away from head height, down to Rahane at deepish forward square leg
back of a length close to off stump, and Khurram pokes at it with an angled bat - a la Gary Kirsten - and chops it past his off stump
back of a length on middle stump, defended towards mid-on
tossed up, angled across towards off and middle. Comes forward and defends into the off side
short and wide, misses out, slaps it straight to backward point
nice flight close to off stump, left alone

and that's number three for Ashwin. Picks the wrong length to sweep on a pitch with this much bounce, gloves it in the air over Dhoni, and Raina moved quickly to his right from slip towards a leg-slip-ish position to take a dolly
tossed up, angling in towards off stump, comes forward and blocks in the direction of mid-on

they're appealing for caught behind! It was flighted, and it dipped and bounced and Mustafa raised his bat in the air in an attempt to leave. Went through to Dhoni, and it must have passed fairly close to the edge. Given not out, and they haven't reviewed. They should have, because replays and Snicko suggest a clear inside edge.
short ball, and you don't bowl there to Shaiman Anwar, who gets up to his full height and swivels to pull it away through square leg. Got nicely on top of the bounce, hitting downwards
back of a length outside off, defended towards point
another bouncer, he didn't have to duck too low because that was well over head height
length ball on off stump, shuffles across and whips it to short midwicket
full inswinger, on the pads, and Dhawan does well to dive to his right at square leg and stop that well-timed flick
again it swings towards middle and leg, clipped to square leg
length ball outside off, pushed to short cover. Played a touch away from his body but kept his bat nice and vertical
tossed up, turns from middle to off. Rohan gets his head over the ball to defend
beauty. Dip, turn and bounce, and Rohan does well to play with soft hands, edge drops short of second slip
a bit quicker and straighter, blocked back to the bowler
slow and loopy outside off. Rohan pushes uncertainly at it and it turns and bounces past his edge
again some dip and turn away from off stump. Left alone this time
fuller, leg-stumpish, clipped away through the on side
short again, pulled to deepish midwicket
full, slanting away from off stump, left alone
length ball outside off, Rohan leaves again
back of a length, again wide enough for the batsman to leave with ease

fuller and straighter now, angling towards off stump, and he's been given lbw! Rohan immediately reviews. He was stuck in the crease, looking to defend, but I don't know if that pitched in line. His bat came down at an angle, a long way from the line of the ball, which straightened in off the pitch. Missed his inside edge by a long way and hit him on the back pad, and that is an excellent decision from the umpire. Pitched well in line, actually, and Hawkeye says it would have crashed into off stump
full on leg stump, clipped away through backward square leg
tossed up, turns from off to leg, tucked away to the right of short midwicket
dangled up outside off and Amjad presses forward to push it away to point
there's that outswinging arm ball again, and it's short enough for Amjad to watch onto his bat and poke away towards point

down the leg side and that is brilliant from Dhoni, got the bails off before I realised it had happened. It's gone up to the third umpire, and Amjad did overbalance a bit, but he got his foot down just in time.
flattish on leg stump and he presses forward to defend. Extra bounce and it pops off the thigh pad towards backward square leg
another arm ball outside off. Shaiman plays late, defends towards point
short now, width as well, and Shaiman rocks back in a flash to cut it away in front of square
and he strikes first ball! Angled in flat with that round-arm action, and it turns away sharply as Amjad comes forward to defend. Edges it into Raina's lap at slip
Oh yes he can. First ball, clears his front leg, opens up, gets down on one knee, exposes all his stumps, anmd simply slogs it away with the angle, over wide long-on
shortish outside off, chopped to backward point
quickish length ball, angling into off and middle, presses forward and squirts a wristy defensive shot into the on side
backs away a long way and Jadeja floats it up slow outside off. Goes for a big drive and can't connect
dropped! That was quickish and it straightened from off stump. Javed was hurried into that defensive poke and Raina, falling to his left, can't hold on at slip
tossed up, turns in towards middle and leg, tucked away to the right of short midwicket
backs away from his stumps again and throws his bat at an attempted drive. Ashwin had slowed it down and he doesn't connect

gets him with a quicker one and that's four for Ashwin, first time in an ODI. Made room even before the bowler was into his final stride, and he fired a quick arm ball on middle and leg. Too quick for Naveed to cut
full legbreak on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
nice flight and dip there, he was halfway forward to defend and he had to jab his bat down in an ungainly manner to deal with the bounce and defend into the on side
a bit quicker outside off and he doesn't get in line quickly enough, pokes and misses
slowish on off stump. Plays from the crease, defends into the off side
a bit fuller, angling in towards middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
on the back foot now, works it away with the angle through square leg
tossed up outside off, comes forward and pushes it to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, clipped to the left of deep square leg

bowled him! That was the falling sweep from Tauqir, but unlike Rohan Kanhai he didn't mean to fall. He plonked his front foot across a long way, and he ended up slipping, and the ball, speared in full, sneaked past his left thigh and crashed into leg stump
back of a length, sharp turn and bounce as Shaiman looks to make room to cut. Cramps him and he defends towards point
makes room again and it's a little fuller now, follows the batsman again, and he defends into the off side
lovely loop and dip, again he follows the backtracking Shaiman, and it spins in sharply to hit his pads
gets a bit of the width he's been looking for, can't beat point with his cut
aaand again. Point is well back on the circle, and he cuts straight to the fielder again
tossed up fuller now and he comes forward to dab it to short third man and keep the strike
fairly full, angling in towards off stump. Shaiman made room to try and carve over cover, and ended up slicing it away towards third man
no appeal, strangely. That came in with the arm as he looked to make room to cut, hit him on the pad. Bounce, I suppose
length ball outisde off, a bit of turn away, left alone
tossed up slow and full on off stump, blocked into the covers
Ashwin is a touch too square at short third man, and for the second time in a row Shaiman edges it in the air to his left. Made room to cut, carved it away uppishly
quickish on off stump, defended towards point
tossed up wide outside off and Guruge gets a good stride out to reach the pitch of the ball and drives it away towards the cover boundary
shortish outside off, punched to sweeper cover, brings Guruge back on strike
appeals for lbw as this turns in and smacks him on the front pad as he stretches out to defend. Was turning down the leg side
back of a length, straightens outside off, pokes at it with an angled bat and can't connect
again this holds its line outside off, a bit fuller, and Guruge pokes hesitantly at it, a long way from the actual ball
fuller and closer to off stump now and he comes forward to defend, gets a thick edge past slip
on the pads, tucked away to short fine leg
a bit of flight into middle stump, looks for the drive towards long-off, bowler runs across to field
goes back to cut, ball goes with the angle and cramps him, chops it to backward point
looks to sweep, it's too full, hits his foot almost on the full, umpire says not out, and replays show a bit of glove
plonks his front foot across again and this time he makes sweet connection with the sweep, powerfully down to the long leg boundary
angled across towards off stump, turns in and it pops off the inside edge, through where short leg might have been, as he prods forward to defend
a touch shorter, poked away towards backward point
full on middle and leg, blocked into the on side
sees a bit of air and goes for the big shot, turns and forces him to hit it squarer that he'd like, towards deep square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, Shaiman goes back and across to work it away through square leg
tossed up on middle stump, Guruge presses forward and smothers it into the on side
length ball on a fourth-stump line, poked away towards short cover
short outside off, too quick for the pull, and he ends up popping it in the air into the off side, bounces down towards mid-off
back of a length on off stump, hops in the air to defend back to the bowler
back of a length, on the pads, clipped away elegantly to the backward square leg boundary
banged in short, Shaiman evades it, getting into a low crouch
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of short cover, didn't time it as well as he would have liked
quick and flat, angling in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
angled in again, towards leg stump this time. Keeps his front pad out of the way and defends towards short cover
he's itching to hit that front pad, but Guruge manages to keep it out of the way and prod it away into the on side
rinse, repeat, defended back to the bowler
marginally slower now and he gets forward to squeeze it away towards square leg
tossed up outside off and Guruge likes that, gets a good stride out and drives with aplomb to the extra cover boundary
Raina is the only slip, and he's at a wide slip. Short outside off and he throws his bat at it, and the edge bisects the gap between Dhoni and Raina
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-off
bowled him, all over! Angled in full, late swing away, and Shaiman looks to whip it away through midwicket and the ball swerves past his outside edge and takes out off stump
